# dataCleaner

<!-- badges: start -->
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/Harrison4192/dataCleaner/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/Harrison4192/dataCleaner/actions)
[![Launch binder](https://mybinder.org/badge_logo.svg)](https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/Harrison4192/dataCleaner/main)
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#experimental)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/dataCleaner)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=dataCleaner)
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of dataCleaner is to provide functions for cleaning common irregularities in raw data sets.

## Installation

You can install the released version of dataCleaner from [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("dataCleaner")
```

And the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("Harrison4192/dataCleaner")
```
